Digital Summit 2020

Digital Summit and Australian Government Digital Awards are on again in 2020. Be part of the community and join us online for a transformation experience.

A virtual Digital Summit 2020

The Digital Summit will be virtual this year, held on 4 separate days from 10 to 19 November 2020. It is an opportunity to come together from across Australia, and explore how government and industry are delivering world-leading digital services for everyone.

If you are passionate about building and delivering user-centred services, the Digital Summit will connect you to ideas, knowledge, and experience, and let you share your story of digital transformation.

Register for updates

On this page

  • Adapt. Engage. Deliver.
  • Get involved as a presenter
  • Award nominations
  • Sponsorship and exhibition opportunities

Adapt. Engage. Deliver.

Join the transformation conversation from the comfort of your own screen. You'll also be able to play back on demand.

Immerse yourself in a showcase and discussion of digital transformation with:

  • keynote speakers
  • plenaries
  • interactive workshops
  • case studies
  • virtual networking opportunities

Themes

  • Day 1: Tuesday 10 November: Disruption and Change
  • Day 2: Thursday 12 November: Human-Centered Government Services
  • Day 3: Tuesday 17 November: Leadership and People
  • Day 4: Thursday 19 November: Technology and Data

Who should attend Digital Summit 2020?

Digital transformation happens when we work and learn together. We invite digital leaders and practitioners working at every level of government, and industry working with government, to the Digital Summit.

If you are a member of the Digital Professional Stream, the Digital Summit is a great opportunity for you to build capability and networks across government and industry.

Digital Summit 2020 program

The Digital Summit is a unique opportunity to make connections with leaders and practitioners in the digital transformation community. This year’s program will include innovative presentations, workshops, and panels on:

  • the current state of digital government services
  • the impact of recent crises and events including COVID-19
  • interactive virtual workshops and case study sessions
  • virtual networking opportunities
  • an exhibition showcasing digital transformation successes from industry and government.

Each day includes:

  • keynote address from a government leader
  • a keynote plenary
  • awards presentation
  • workshops
  • case study presentations
  • expo session with industry.

The Minister for Government Services the Hon Stuart Robert MP will provide the first keynote address on day one of the Digital Summit.

Registered attendees can view all sessions on demand following the Digital Summit.

Australian Government Digital Awards 2020

The Australian Government Digital Awards recognise and celebrate the best examples of digital practice across government and industry working with government. This year the Awards are part of the Digital Summit. They will take place on 10, 12, 17 November 2020.

Back to top

Get involved as a presenter

The Digital Summit is open to practitioners and agencies across the Australian Public Service and industry. Topics cover Disruption and Change, Human-Centred Government Services, Leadership and People, and Technology and Data.

We are looking for presenters to deliver government digital transformation and capability through:

  • case studies
  • workshops and presentations

Applications to present at the Digital Summit close midnight, 23 August 2020.

Call for Case studies
Call for speakers, workshops and presentations

Back to top

Award nominations

We’re celebrating the Australian Government Digital Awards at the Digital Summit.

The awards this year are:

  1. Outstanding digital product or service
  2. Outstanding government platform
  3. Outstanding use of emerging technology
  4. Outstanding digital methodology or approach
  5. Excellence in government/industry partnership
  6. Excellence in multi-agency partnership
  7. Emerging digital talent (individual with less than 5 years in digital role)
  8. Digital professional (individual with more than 5 years in digital role)
  9. Digital Diversity (for individual, organisation, product or service that promotes diversity in government digital transformation)

Nominations close midnight, 7 September 2020.

For more information, email awards@dta.gov.au or

Read the criteria and start your Awards application

Sponsorship and exhibition opportunities

We’re looking for industry sponsors and exhibitors to help our attendees ‘Adapt. Engage. Deliver.’  Your products and services will need to be relevant to our digital transformation themes.

To become a sponsor or exhibitor:

  1. Read our Call for Sponsors and Virtual Exhibitors and the terms and conditions.
  2. Download the Industry Sponsorship and Exhibitor prospectus.
  3. Apply through the Sponsor and Exhibitor EOI portal
  4. If you need an accessible form, please contact summit@dta.gov.au.

If you have any questions, please email summit@dta.gov.au.
